description.narrative: (i) Access to Broadband: The Project addresses the growing demand for fiber networks critically needed to support the expansion of broadband services. (ii) Shared infrastructure: As telecom operators are under pressure to expand their networks and improve their level/quality of service, a company like CSquared will be well positioned to provide high quality infrastructure services more efficiently. (iii) Promote economic growth: Improved broadband connectivity directly and indirectly benefits virtually every sector of the economy, creates jobs, fosters innovation and entrepreneurship, promotes social and financial inclusion and improves transparency and efficiency. Broadband access is also expected to help small and medium enterprises to better market their good and services, both locally and internationally.

IFC together with Google Inc, Convergence Partners and Mitsui & Co., Ltd. (Mitsui) start a partnership in CSquared, a broadband infrastructure company focused on building wholesale, carrierneutral open-access fibre optic networks in Sub-Saharan Africa (the Project). The Project will initially involve the development and expansion of the existing operations initiated by Google in Uganda, Ghana. CSquared will then serve as a platform to expand into new markets with additional investments in the Sub-Saharan Africa region in the future. The Project targets to provide key sector players in these markets, such as mobile operators or internet service providers, with access to an essential shared communication infrastructure that would enable them to improve broadband connectivity as well as the quality of services and their affordability. CSquared has operations in Uganda, Ghana and Liberia and is considering new markets, including Togo. To support CSquared expansion into Togo, the Project is expected to be supported by the IDA19 Private Sector Window Blended Finance Facility as described under Blended Finance.
